Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 101-457.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 280.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Lagomarsino demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: To recognize the centennials of national parks and monuments, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Parks Centennial Act of 1990 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to appoint a Centennial Commission for each national park established less than 97 years before enactment of this Act. Requires each Commission to plan appropriate activities to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the park's establishment. Requires the Secretary to transmit to specified congressional committees a list of parks celebrating their centennials within the next five years. Directs the Secretary to arrange for the preparation of a centennial history of each park, including Yellowstone National Park and Yosemite and Sequoia National Parks, California. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: Parks and Monuments Centennial Act of 1989
To recognize the centennials of national parks and monuments, and for other purposes.
